intro: Draba verna var. micrantha, commonly known as the spring whitlow grass, is a low-growing perennial herb native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically reaches heights of 5 to 15 centimeters and features basal rosettes of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring, usually from March to May, depending on the climate. Its flowers are clustered in dense, terminal inflorescences and are pollinated primarily by insects. Draba verna var. micrantha is adapted to rocky or disturbed soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments.
